com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class RouteManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteManager
  • Deprecated. 
    As of SDK 3.2. Use an SDK component which implements the Router interface. For core routing types (Car, Truck, Pedestrian) the appropriate class is CoreRouter. For Public Transit routing the appropriate class is UMRouter.

    @Deprecated
public class RouteManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a manager responsible for calculating a Route from a RoutePlan, with a RouteManager.Listener to monitor calculation progress and trigger appropriate callback methods upon completion.

    Before using a RouteManager, an application must set appropriate the HERE developer credentials.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RouteManager

        @Deprecated
public RouteManager()
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use an SDK component which implements the Router interface. For core routing types (Car, Truck, Pedestrian) the appropriate class is CoreRouter. For Public Transit routing the appropriate class is UMRouter.
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateRoute

        @Deprecated
public RouteManager.Error calculateRoute(RoutePlan routePlan,
                                           RouteManager.Listener listener)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use CoreRouter#calculateRoute .
        Invokes an asynchronous route calculation. Upon completion of the request, the Listener will be invoked regardless if the request is completed successfully or not.
        Parameters:
        routePlan - A RoutePlan used to calculate the route
        listener - A Listener for the RouteManager
        Returns:
        The RouteManager.Error error code, one of:
        • RouteManager.Error#NONE if route calculation is started
        • RouteManager.Error#INVALID_OPERATION if a route calculation could not be started because a calculation is already in progress
        • RouteManager.Error#INVALID_PARAMETERS if any of the input parameters is null or the RoutePlan is invalid
        • All other errors also indicate route calculation could not be started

        As of 3.2.2, This method returns RouteManager.Error#INVALID_PARAMETERS and a route will not be calculated if calculating a route with RouteOptions.TransportMode.TRACK since calculating a route in track mode is no longer supported.

      • cancel

        @Deprecated
public void cancel()
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use Router.cancel().
        Cancels the current route calculation. Note that this API is asynchronous as it takes some time cancel all underlying operations. {Please use RouteManager#isBusy() to check when the RouteManager is free again. Upon completion of the request, the Listener#onCalculateRouteFinished(Error, List) callback with error code RouteManager.Error#ROUTING_CANCELLED will be invoked.

      • isBusy

        @Deprecated
public boolean isBusy()
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use Router.isBusy().
        Query whether the RouteManager is currently busy computing a route.
        Returns:
        true if a route calculation is ongoing, false otherwise.

      • getTrafficPenaltyMode

        @Deprecated
public Route.TrafficPenaltyMode getTrafficPenaltyMode()
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.0.1. Use DynamicPenalty.getTrafficPenaltyMode().
        Checks the traffic penalty mode for route calculations.
        Returns:
        The Route.TrafficPenaltyMode used for calculations
        See Also:
        RouteManager.getDynamicPenalty()

      • setTrafficPenaltyMode

        @Deprecated
public RouteManager setTrafficPenaltyMode(Route.TrafficPenaltyMode mode)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.0.1. Use DynamicPenalty.setTrafficPenaltyMode(Route.TrafficPenaltyMode)
        Set whether route calculation should take traffic into account. The default value is Route.TrafficPenaltyMode.DISABLED.
        Parameters:
        mode - A TrafficPenaltyMode indicating whether to take traffic into account.
        Returns:
        RouteManager, for chaining setTrafficPenaltyMode() calls.
        See Also:
        RouteManager.setDynamicPenalty(DynamicPenalty)

      • setDynamicPenalty

        @Deprecated
public RouteManager setDynamicPenalty(DynamicPenalty penalty)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use CoreRouter.setDynamicPenalty(DynamicPenalty)
        Sets the dynamic penalty that should be applied to route calculations.Penalties can be applied in the form of restricting roads, areas and setting different traffic modes.

        Note: Passing null will set the default penalties.

        Parameters:
        penalty - DynamicPenalty penalty used for route calculation
        Returns:
        This RouteManager

      • getDynamicPenalty

        @Deprecated
public DynamicPenalty getDynamicPenalty()
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use CoreRouter.getDynamicPenalty()
        Get the different penalties which is responsible to change the routing conditions.
        Returns:
        DynamicPenalty used for route calculation
